title: Systemic Macro-Financial Risk Analysis (MFRA)
description: This course provides participants with a comprehensive understanding of the theories, tools, and techniques needed to conduct thorough financial stability analysis.

title: Macroprudential Policy Implementation and Challenges
description: Practical training on the effective use of macroprudential instruments and related governance issues.

title: Climate Risks in the Financial System (Online)
description: Introduction to measuring and managing the impact of climate change on financial stability.

title: Financial Stability Policies (FSP)
description: Presented by the IMF, this course provides a comprehensive overview of policies to safeguard financial stability, covering both micro- and macroprudential perspectives.

title: Advanced Stress Testing for Financial Institutions
description: Deep dive into advanced methodologies for solvency and liquidity stress testing for banks and insurers.

title: FinTech and the Future of Finance (Online)
description: Examines the impact of digitalization, crypto-assets, and AI on financial markets and stability.

title: Financial Stability Policy of the Eurosystem
description: Covers the institutional framework and practical implementation of macroprudential policy in the euro area.

title: Climate Stress Testing Seminar
description: A high-level seminar on the latest methodologies for climate scenario analysis and its impact on the banking sector.

title: Financial Soundness Indicators (FSI-C)
description: This course introduces the compilation and use of Financial Soundness Indicators (FSIs) for macroprudential analysis and surveillance of the financial sector.

title: Applied Economic Forecasting (AEF)
description: A course by the Austrian National Bank on practical forecasting of key macroeconomic variables relevant for policy making.
